qas.question: Why were there armor changes in the 1500s?

answers.text: the advent of firearms, new fighting tactics and the need for additional protection

qas.question: What type of armor was replaced?
What new type of armor replaced the old?
What was the new armor called?
When was samurai armor last used?

context: In the 1500s a new type of armor started to become popular due to <a0_0>the advent of firearms, new fighting tactics and the need for additional protection<a0_0/>. The <a1_0>kozane dou<a1_0/> made from individual scales was replaced by <a2_0>plate armor<a2_0/>. This new armor, which used iron plated dou (dō), was referred to as <a3_0>Tosei-gusoku<a3_0/>, or modern armor. Various other components of armor protected the samurai's body. The helmet kabuto was an important part of the samurai's armor. Samurai armor changed and developed as the methods of samurai warfare changed over the centuries. The known last use of samurai armor occurring in <a4_0>1877<a4_0/> during the satsuma rebellion. As the last samurai rebellion was crushed, Japan modernized its defenses and turned to a national conscription army that used uniforms.
